content: What do you recommend doing if I'm not doing well on the microquizzes? I feel like I'm doing everything I can to prepare- I make sure I understand all the notes from lecture/recitation and the finger exercises, and do all of the practice questions on mitx. I also find the psets to not be terribly hard, I've been scoring well on my checkoffs, and I go to office hours when I don't understand something. Finally, I make sure to review what I did wrong/understand the correct solutions on past quizzes. Do you have any tips of how to score better? I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong.
subject: What should I do if I'm not scoring very well on microquizzes?

content:
One thing I would do is to review "correct" microquiz solutions,

ensure that I understand them fully,

and then practice reimplementing them again from scratch.
